text: Psalm 7
Prayer for Deliverance from Enemies
A Shiggaion\f + \fr Ps 7 \ft Meaning uncertain; perhaps a lamentation \f* of David which he sang to Yahweh
on account of Cush, a Benjaminite.\f + \fr Ps 7 \ft The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm; the English verse number is reduced by one \f*
O Yahweh, my God, in you I have taken refuge.
Save me from all \add who\add* pursue me, and deliver me.
Or else he will tear me apart like a lion,
ripping to pieces, with none \add to\add* deliver.
O Yahweh, my God, if I have done this,
if there is wrong in my hands,
if I have repaid ⸤my ally⸥\f + \fr 7:4 \ft Literally “\fq one \ft being at peace with me” \f* \add with\add* harm,
or \add if\add* I have plundered my enemy without cause,
let the enemy of my soul pursue,
and overtake and trample my life into the ground,
and lay my honor in the dust. \qs Selah\qs*
Rise up, O Yahweh, in your anger,
and lift yourself up against the wrath\f + \fr 7:6 \ft Or “outbursts” \f* of my oppressors,
and awake for me,
since you have commanded judgment.
And let \add the\add* assembly of peoples surround you,
and over it return on high.
Yahweh judges the nations.
O Yahweh, vindicate me
according to my innocence\f + \fr 7:8 \ft Or “righteousness” \f* and according to my integrity within me.
Let the evil of the wicked come to an end,
but establish \add the\add* righteous,
and test the hearts and innermost being, O righteous God.
My shield \add is\add* with God
who saves the upright of heart.
God \add is\add* a righteous judge,
and a God who has indignation every day.
If he\f + \fr 7:12 \ft That is, a person \f* does not repent, he\f + \fr 7:12 \ft That is, God \f* will sharpen his sword.
He has bent his bow and he has ⸤strung⸥\f + \fr 7:12 \ft Literally “prepared” \f* it.
And he has prepared for him weapons of death.
He has made his arrows fiery shafts.
See, he\f + \fr 7:14 \ft That is, the wicked \f* travails with\f + \fr 7:14 \ft Or “conceives” \f* evil.
He is pregnant with trouble,
and he gives birth to deception.
He makes a pit and digs it out,
then falls in \add the\add* trap he has made.
His trouble comes back on his head,
and his violence comes down on his skull.
I will thank Yahweh according to his righteousness,
and I will sing praise to the name of Yahweh, \add the\add* Most High.
